fields.summary: POST HOOK sometimes returns null branch (BB-11525)

fields.description:
From a support issue:

When typing in the "find commits" field on the commits page, the search executes at a random point in time, and moves the focus away from the search field.\\
The experience for me was typing "And" into the box trying to type "AndySomerville" and the search executed on "And" completely subverting my intentions.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to type a series of characters into the search field on the commit screen without the field losing focus (BB-11481)

fields.description:
Hello,\\
I've just registered, I'm able to login, and I've got the confirmation email, but when I click on "Confirm this email address", I always get this error:

We were unable to confirm the email address. The validation email may have expired.

Thank you,\\
Massimo Modica
fields.summary: Confirming email address

fields.description:
We've just switch to Bitbucket (since Semaphore now integrates with it) and love many aspects of it's Pull Requests over Github.

One thing we really miss is Github's Commit Status API (which Semaphore integrates with)\\
It's best explained at https://github.com/blog/1227-commit-status-api
fields.summary: Commit Status API (like Github) (BB-11480)

fields.description:
From a support issue:

The PRs/commits that are being watched are sending email notifications as expected. The problem is that commits on PRs are not automatically set to watching (even for the person who made the commit!).\\
I can't imagine a scenario where a user creates a pull request, makes a commit, has the reviewer make a comment in the commit, and the original user doesn't get an email notification by default?
fields.summary: As a repository user, I would like to be automatically added as a watcher to all commits I've authored. (BB-11479)

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I've been developing some scripts in MATLAB and created a repository in MATLAB language. However, I've noticed that if I'd like to edit the source code in a web browser, the scripts in the editor looks like "plain text". If want to change to MATLAB, there are plenty of languages except MATLAB. To enhance web editor for whom manages the code consulting instead of code coding, it would be great to have MATLAB language in Bitbucket web editor.

Best regards from Istanbul.

++Ahmet (2014_1029)
fields.summary: Language MATLAB is missing in Online Editor. (BB-11477)

fields.description:
Using :git version 1.9.4.msysgit.2 (on windows 7 64bit)\\
unable to clone or pull anything from a repository, getting the following message:

remote: Counting objects: 1882, done.\\
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (1042/1042), done.\\
select: Not enough memory139/1882), 102.89 MiB | 34.00 KiB/s\\
ffatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly\\
atal: early EOF\\
fatal: index-pack failed

usually fails after getting to around 100mb of objects received.\\
even tried deleting the master branch which was 200mb, but it did not help.

failed also using sourcetree, and git bash ( in windows).

Cloning the same project a few weeks ago in another system\\
worked well more then once.
fields.summary: Unable to clone project / pull or fetch from project
Pull requests to a closed branch cannot be updated to point to an open branch (redux) (BB-11484)

fields.description:
Currently, we require users to go into their Bitbucket mailbox to confirm any repository transfers to their account. We should make this easier.

Suggestions:

* Setup a static page linked from the banner at the top, with a confirm button.
* Setup a confirm button within the banner itself
fields.summary: Make repository transfer confirmation more visible (BB-11474)

fields.description: When using Bitbucket through the browser, I would like to see a shorter timeout of my session and its tokens, to prevent an attacker stealing my tokens or computer and impersonating my account.
fields.summary: As a security-minded user, I would like the session timeout to be reduced to a smaller value. (BB-11473)

fields.description: hi, i accidently deleted a repository in source tree and bitbucket it was called Audiogids, now i    am not able to find the file annywhere and this was becuase i wanted to make a new map for the files. i deleted the old repository and then copied the map with the files on my computer but it seemed that the map was empty (only the git. files where still there) i will be very happy if i am able to get that repository back so i can fix this mistake i made
fields.summary: deleted repository

fields.description:
Browser: Chrome\\
Bitbucket -> Pull Request -> Side by Side diff\\
When scrolling the side-by-side diff view, if the diff file ends, the\\
background page starts scrolling. This is really inconvenient because when\\
the side-by-side diff is closed, you return to the pull request page but it\\
would have scrolled and you won't be where you had left. Extremely\\
inconvenient for large pull requests.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like the background page to be prevented from scrolling when using the side-by-side diff view. (BB-11472)

fields.description:
Hi, I just created a new account and after clicking sign up I got this error:\\
Your account has been deactivated. Please contact Bitbucket Support for assistance.

The accounts username is renanb6. Is there any possibility to use this account or must I sign up with another username? And why did this happen (so I can avoid it for the next time)?

Thanks for help.
fields.summary: Account deactivate

fields.description:
Having a way to group multiple git repositories into projects would be a neat feature. For instance most my company projects end up having three repositories (min), one for documentation exchanged with the client (LaTeX Documents), one for the actual project source code and one for the project documentation.

Right now we simply give all of them the same name and append their purpose to the end, but would be very nice to have a way of grouping them in BitBucket.
fields.summary: Grouping repositories into projects

Under issue tracker settings, bullet points in the issue tracker are ignored.

The preview button on the edit box also does nothing.

fields.description:
In Repository settings / Repository details, changing the ‘Forking’ drop-down menu from “Allow only private forks” to “Allow forks” and then clicking ‘Save repository details’ has no effect.

The page reloads, and “Allow only private forks” is still selected.

Additionally, when doing the above while also trying to change the repository from private to public, the error message “ Public repositories must allow public forks” is displayed. In this case, the drop-down does now show “Allow forks”, but on refreshing the page again, it has reset to “Only private forks” again.

Additionally BCLOUD-2: When creating a repository, you cannot select the “public” option for the same reason as the first Additionally :)
fields.summary: Cannot select "allow public forks" repository option

fields.description: When I push some commits to bitbucket, the commit are associated with the bitbucket-user by using the email configured in the local git-config (user.email). I think that user.name should be used. Since user.email can be configured at will, anybody can change it and by doing so, make commits which are displayed with another user account.
fields.summary: Mapping commit -> user

fields.description: Install Git and source tree. Clone repo to your local.
fields.summary: Set up Git and Clone the repositories to your local

fields.description: Documentation at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Grant+users+and+groups+access mentions adding Teams to Repos. This feature has been removed, so let's amend the docs.
fields.summary: Change docs to match User Add behaviour to Repo regarding Teams (BB-11466)

fields.description:
I can't seem to find a way to create a new branch from a repo with the 2.0 API.\\
Is this on the road map or is this already being done?
fields.summary: As a developer, I would like an API endpoint for creating a new branch. (BB-11465)

fields.description: Please correct the documentation to be consistent with current behaviour.
fields.summary: Issue link does not fire when used with "issue #<foo>" format; must use "refs #<foo>" instead (BB-11464)

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a hierarchy of issues. For instance I could create\\
an issue with sub-issues within that.
fields.summary: Add a Hierarchy of issues

fields.description:
In a comment discussion about the obscurely placed repository size (cf. starting here [Re: What kind of limits do you have on repository/file/upload size?|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action%3FpageId%3D273877699%26focusedCommentId%3D608961509#comment-608961509]), Marcus Bertrand [Atlassian] has two comments about the fact that the repository size "previously was on the repository overview" – a very logical and accessible location.  As he and Erik van Zijst [Atlassian] explained, it was subsequently moved to its present (non-obvious and not always accessible) location.

Besides being a non-obvious location (i.e. no one sets the repository size as one sets other settings on the Settings page), putting it into the Settings also creates access problems for those who do not have permission to change Settings.  This was discovered and pointed out by Christopher Corbell (cf. comments starting here [Re: Reduce repository size|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Reduce%2Brepository%2Bsize%3FfocusedCommentId%3D678691741#comment-678691741]).

Moving repository size back into the repository overview -- where everyone can easily find it and all are allowed to see it -- would be a very good fix from the earlier change that created these problems.
fields.summary: Move the repository size from the Settings page back to the Overview page. (BB-11462)

fields.description:
Hi!

Long ago I created a team with the name of "InfinityWeb Team".\\
Later I quit this team. Now I gave no rights in there.\\
I created another one team called "MTW Team".

I absolutely have no "leftovers" of "InfinityWeb" team in my SourceTree/Git('local/global') configurations.

But somehow when I browse my commits via BitBucket site I can see the team's old name instead of my login name.

Can you please help to figure this out? Thanks!
fields.summary: Commits are listed under the wrong username.

fields.description:
Hi.

This issue is raised on behalf of scott at tricific dot com.

h2. When I go to this link for information on how to work with teams in Bitbucket, the video when clicked says "This video is private"\\
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Bitbucket+Teams\\
I'm using Chrome Version 39.0.2171.27 beta (64-bit)\\
I attempted to get the video URL (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=LbLlrFzF7WE) still says: -
h2. This video is private.\\
Sorry about that.\\
0:00 / 0:00
Hope this helps.
fields.summary: Bitbucket teams documentation (video) is private. (BB-11463)

fields.description:
We are increasingly seeing this message when trying to view the diffs in a pull request. In some cases refreshing the browser a couple of times seems to get it to load properly. But in some cases it just repeatedly comes up with the above message.\\
The pull requests do not contain an excessive number of changes (may be 40 files) and none of the files have that many diffs.\\
It seems as though if the request takes more that about 15 seconds it just gives up and says it is too large; this makes the tool unusable if it imposing such a low limit on how large our changes can be.\\
Can there not be some configuration on the time out? Or better still it return the list of files and allow each to be clicked on separately to display the diffs one file at a time, in cases where it takes too long to process the whole thing.
fields.summary: Regularly get "This merge is too large to display." message in pull requests, that aren't really that big.

fields.description:
When performing a merge operation online, we're able to select the option to "close source branch", which it's fine and desirable if the merge is successful.

But if the merge is not successful because conflicts need to be addressed manually, bitbucket is still closing the source branch, and it really really shouldn't.

When attempting (and failing to merge), that branch disappears, and if it was also deleted locally, we're unable to recover the lost work and resolve the conflicts manually.

This is actually very very dangerous because when the original submitter of the pull request publishes its feature-branch to the server, he assumes that since it's published, there's no need to keep a local copy of such branch and sometimes delete it. This causes situations where the work done is totally lost.

Maybe the application should even detect/predict that the merge will NOT be successful and not provide the option to merge at all, such as what happens on a pull request, where the "merge" button is disabled and unclickable in such situations?
fields.summary: "Close source branch" is deleting branches even when the branch isn't merged causing data loss

fields.description:
when uploading a png image with a filename that includes colons, the image is not shown in the issue.

!733509014-Screenshot%20from%202014-10-21%2012:42:28.png|thumbnail!

fields.description:
Please, add abilities to:

* change user name from "Bitbucket" to something more beautiful, for example, I would like to change name to Ava Johnson (she is our AI, she works with my team, http://deusex.wikia.com/wiki/Ava_Johnson :-) )
* change colour from grey to purple for all push notifications and to yellow for all comment notifications… we would like to customize it because of we use different colours for different types of messages types and based on their priorities...
* send full commit message in chat (without "..." at the end if commit message is big), because of HipChat is not Twitter, we need all details there in one message...
fields.summary: HipChat Integration (BB-11453)

fields.description:
You can select users or groups from teams. However, the team can have an SSH key in its own right. Why can't I limit to this SSH key?

I understood the intention of the Team SSH keys was to prevent the need for dummy accounts used to push changes for the team. Therefore it seems an oversight that I'd have to resort to a dummy account if I wanted to take advantage of restricting pushes to branches.

https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Branch+management#Branchmanagement-Limitpushpowers
fields.summary: Unable to select team SSH key when limiting pushes to repository branches (BB-11444)

fields.description:
*first things first - we are totally happy and grateful for our academic license at HTL Spengergasse for Bitbucket.*

Based on our campus work, we do (will) have a huge number of groups for access management. Please make group management more usable. Currently it is just a ever growing list of groups with its users beneath.

* I would come up with the idea of collapsable groups or
* another column with the group-names and in the third column the members of the group.

Hopefully you find this suggestions suitable and not offending and maybe one day it (or an even better solution from you) will see day of light

fields.description: This issue tracker is for tracking known issues and feature requests on Bitbucket. If you'd like to report a bug, please use [our support page|https://bitbucket.org/support] and search for your issue before raising a new issue. In many cases, the issue may have been reported before. If you cannot find your issue, please raise a new support request from [our support page|https://bitbucket.org/support]. A member of the support team will assist you in verifying your issue, and will open a bug report for you if needed.

fields.description:
Trying to use a event endpoint for a public repository-

https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/{accountName}/{repo Slug}/events/

returns response with a count 30 even if more than 30 event are available.

As per the api docs and comments mentioned below the event resource docs,solution would have been to look for an exact event count in one call to the endpoint and making next calls for fetching events in batches of 30 by providing 'start' and 'limit' params.

But it looks like event count itself does not go beyond 30.

Either the count is wrong or bitbucket does not have an API to fetch entire event history for a user/repo
fields.summary: REST API: Event resource returns a wrong event count(does not go beyond 30) (BB-11421)

fields.description:
Hi,\\
In a bug report, when trying to direct a comment at my team mate\\
'l.diekmann' I notice that upon clicking submit, the user name is\\
incorrectly modified.\\
The message "@l.diekmann we can close this?" becomes:\\
"Leif Halvard Silli.diekmann we can close this?".\\
Lief's username is '@l'. I guess your parser sees the dot as a\\
terminating character for the username.\\
–\\
Best Regards\\
Edd Barrett
fields.summary: @name broken in issue comments (BB-11420)

fields.summary: I wish to display active Pull requests in a confluence page (BB-11422)

fields.description:
I know Bitbucket can create a new repository by cloning another remote one. It is good for moving the master repository to Bitbucket entirely and to make further changes only on Bitbucket.

But if I cloned the remote repository just for custom modification or for reference, there will be more changes not available in my cloned one.  I think it would be nice to have a feature to pull those changes again from the original one in the Bitbucket Web UI, even if I could do it by pulling changes from the original repository to local one and manually pushing them to Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Pulling revisions from a remote repository on Web (BB-11417)

fields.description:
There are multiple cases when development teams want to check the push to the remote repository and either accept or reject it. Some may check branch names, commit messages, fast-forward merges, etc. to ensure the development process follows some particular rules.

Currently, it does not seem to be possible with Bitbucket to use this functionality that actually comes out of the box with Git. The user does not have access to the actual remote repository to manage that. However, it can be provided in a different way using the approach similar to Bitbucket Hooks' POST request. When the repository gets triggered on "pre-receive" event, it could execute HTTP POST request supplying all the information from the push, and accept it if the POST request returns 200 or reject if any other HTTP code. This would still not require to provide direct access to the remote repository, but the users could still handle commits and reject them using their specific rules.

PS Related but less generalized ticket:

Enhancement BCLOUD-5658 Allow custom pre-receive hook that rejects commits without an issue key in their message
fields.summary: Git server-side "pre-receive" hook (BB-11418)

fields.description:
In .NET, updating a WCF service reference can generate huge changes in a dozen generated files, none of which are relevant to understanding what a pull request is really changing.

When creating a pull request, It would be nice to mark files in the pull request as "irrelevant" so they are hidden from reviewers by default.

The reviewer could unhide the changes, but usually seeing several KB of {{svcinfo}} and {{xsd}} files changing is unhelpful.

With this feature, reviewers would be directed at the important files in the pull request and the boilerplate changes would be hidden.
fields.summary: Allow hiding irrelevant files from pull requests

fields.description:
Hi,

I have two bitbucket accounts. I am trying to pull from one of them (git@bitbucket.org.voto:jojoo/votocn.git) and it does not work.

*What did I do?*\\
I did {{$git pull}}.

*What did I expect to happen?*\\
I expected the command would pull the latest changes.

*What happened instead?*\\
I got the following error:

{code}
conq: repository does not exist.
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
{code}

*More information*\\
The .git/config file for the repo from which I want to pull looks like this:

{code}
#!config

[core]
        repositoryformatversion = 0 
        filemode = true
        bare = false
        logallrefupdates = true
        ignorecase = true
        precomposeunicode = true
[remote "origin"]
        url = git@bitbucket.org.voto:jojoo/votocn.git
        fetch = +refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/origin/*
[branch "master"]
        remote = origin
        merge = refs/heads/master
[branch "csvExportAPI"]
        remote = origin
        merge = refs/heads/csvExportAPI
[user]
        email = jojoo@votomobile.org
        name = Jojoo Imbeah
{code}

My .ssh/config looks like the following:

{code}
Host bitbucket.org.voto
  Hostname bitbucket.org
  User git 
  IdentityFile /path/to/privatekey
  IdentitiesOnly yes 

Host bitbucket.org
  Hostname bitbucket.org
  User git 
  IdentityFile /path/to/secondprivatekey
  IdentitiesOnly yes 
{code}
fields.summary: Unable to git pull
